page.title: 16Ecology
page.content: Tholthorpe village is built along both sides of the main street, one side of the back lane and around the green which has a pond in the middle. This is fed from a spring. The water is rich in nutrients and supports numerous plants, fungae, fish and frogs. Eugleane Sangunea, the most dramatic fungus responds to sunshine by changing from bright green to red. The undulating land in the area, a terinae moraine, varies from a very light sand which is sometimes blown byy the strong springtime winds to a silty clay prone to water logging. Hedgerow trees are mainly Oak, Ash, & Sycamore. Hawthorne, Blackthorne, Elderberry, Wild rose & Bramble form the hedges. Alder & Willow are common along the beckside and together with reeds, rushes, willowherb & grasses create a habitat for fowes, rabbits,
